SEARCH

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
Ship
public class Ship extends Object
Represents a ship with an engine, hull, crew, and antenna. Provides functionality to start the ship's journey, change components, adjust speed, and log actions. The ship is also capable of handling an emergency when the hull is damaged.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Ship(Engine engine_, Hull hull_, Crew crew_, Antenna antenna_)
    Constructs a ship with the specified components and initializes a log file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship(Engine engine_, Hull hull_, Crew crew_, Antenna antenna_) throws IOException
      Constructs a ship with the specified components and initializes a log file.
      Parameters:
      engine_ - The engine of the ship
      hull_ - The hull of the ship
      crew_ - The crew of the ship
      antenna_ - The antenna of the ship
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error initializing the log file

  • Method Details

    • startJourney

      public void startJourney() throws IOException
      Starts the journey of the ship, allowing the captain to enter commands to control the ship's actions. The loop will continue until the captain commands to return to port or the ship is damaged.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error processing commands or interacting with components

    • getShipInfo

      public void getShipInfo() throws IOException
      Displays the ship's current information such as the hull, crew, engine, and antenna.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error logging the ship's information

    • replaceEngine

      public void replaceEngine() throws IOException
      Allows the captain to replace the engine with a new one. Logs the action and updates the engine's parameters.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error processing the engine replacement

    • changeCrew

      public void changeCrew() throws IOException
      Allows the captain to change the crew size. The crew size must be between 5 and 50.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error processing the crew change

    • adjustSpeed

      public void adjustSpeed() throws IOException
      Adjusts the ship's speed. The captain can set the speed up to a maximum of 9 knots. If the engine is off, the speed cannot be changed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error processing the speed change

    • turn

      public void turn() throws IOException
      Turns the ship in a specified direction. Logs the action and applies the direction.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error processing the turn

    • move

      public boolean move() throws IOException
      Controls the movement of the ship by turning the engine on or off. The captain is prompted to enter the engine mode (1 for turning the engine on, 2 for turning it off). Based on the input, the engine is either powered up to full capacity or turned off, causing the ship to either move forward or drift.
      Returns:
      boolean The current state of the engine after the action (true if the engine is on, false if off).
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error logging the action to the log file.

    • returnToPort

      public void returnToPort() throws IOException
      Returns the ship to port, ending the journey.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error logging the return action
